A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I find the stellar reviews from critics baffling. The film lacks the most important quality of star wars - imagination. Star wars is a franchise that transcends divides - generational\, political\, gender etc. We marvel in the nativity and wonder of this galaxy - in this black and white world - as a form of escapism. Johnson succeeded in obliterating that magic; Planet Monaco and its weapon dealing oligarchs with super cars? Star wars is meant to hark to the familiar\, not replicate it - bloody hell.\n If Johnson was so bent on grounding star wars to the real world he should have offered a substantial plot twist that released the franchise from its biggest philosophical short coming - its black and white morality. I think it crossed his mind\, but then he didn't have the balls to go through with it.Shame because this Beautifully made film could have been the beginning of a really interesting evolution for the franchise.\n Shame the efforts and talents of so many people who made this film happen both on screen and behind the scenes are let down/
